item.title: Lolddos
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:16, topic:239579”][quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=315865.msg2509796#msg2509796 date=1225226712]

Do you have the access required to null route IPs? If so I’ll give you my list of attackers (2200+ unique IPs) for you to null route.

I don’t know what that means but it sounds fun teach me = ) jk
[/quote]http://www.cyberciti.biz/faq/howto-null-route-an-attackers-ip/

Not specifically special. Just the act of rendering an attacker’s IP…useless.[/quote]

It is better not to use IPTABLES if you don’t need that advanced functionality. If you are simply blocking an IP do it this way:

route add -host 123.123.123.123 reject

Read full topic

item.title: Lolddos
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:4, topic:239579”]74.14.102.98
62.150.204.215

There’s IPs of the most constant ‘attackers.’[/quote]One is hosted by Bell Canada, and you could have them cut the internet for that customer by contacting :

OrgName: Bell Canada
OrgID: LINX
Address:
City: toronto
StateProv: ON
PostalCode: K1G-3J4
Country: CA

Or call the abuse people at :

1-877-877-2426

The other IP registers to the RIPE internet company, which is a company in the Netherlands. You can contact them here:

Office Location:
RIPE NCC
Singel 258
1016 AB Amsterdam
The Netherlands

Phone: +31 20 535 4444
Fax: +31 20 535 4445

Postal Address:
RIPE NCC
P.O. Box 10096
1001EB Amsterdam
The Netherlands

Both hosting companies have a record of disconnecting “bad apples” if proper proof can be showed/given.

Read full topic

item.title: Lolddos
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

iptables.

johnr@spark-server:~$ nmap -P0 62.150.204.215

Starting Nmap 4.53 ( http://insecure.org ) at 2008-10-28 15:51 EDT
Interesting ports on adsl4-215.qualitynet.net (62.150.204.215):
Not shown: 1713 filtered ports
PORT     STATE SERVICE
5190/tcp open  aol
johnr@spark-server:~$ nmap -P0 74.14.102.98

Starting Nmap 4.53 ( http://insecure.org ) at 2008-10-28 15:54 EDT
All 1714 scanned ports on bas4-windsor12-1242457698.dsl.bell.ca (74.14.102.98) are filtered

Dunno what the fuck aol is for. They both appear to be behind routers.

Read full topic
